Note:
For Latin texts see Singer (1928)
XSinger, Dorothea Waley. Catalogue of Latin and Vernacular Alchemical Manuscripts. 3 vols. Brussels: Lamertin, 1928-31, 2.649-51.
Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Bodleian Library Arch. Dd.1 (SC 31502) [photographic facsimile (1893) of Oxford, Bodleian Library Duke Humfrey d.2 [olim Earl Fitzwilliam]]: see BodEngPoed27.
_description: Palladius on Husbondrie, in twelve books — rhyme royal stanzas

BodAddA369.First Lines:
Consideraunce is taken atte prudenceWhat mon me moost enfourme and
                    husbondrieNo Rethorik doo teche or eloquenceAs sum haue doon hemself
                    to magnifie…
BodAddA369.Last Lines:
…Doon in and dreynt a cruste vpon it makeAnd fille it to the
                    brinke vntil it take
BodAddA369.Note:
Begins with the table of contents entitled ‘Tabula’; the
                    title page and part of the table of contents are missing; the text of the poem
                    starts on f. 14v; ends imperfectly due to loss of folios at
                    end.
BodAddA369.Editions:
Lodge,  Burton,  and  S. J. Herrtage, eds.  
             Palladius on Husbondrie.
EETS
         o.s. 52, 72 (1872, 1879); repr. 1988.

BodDHumd2.First Lines:
COnsideraunce is taken at prudenceWhat man me must enfourme And
                    husbondrie…
BodDHumd2.Last Lines:
…Thy self in hym to se yit treste y crieThy lande And his
                    honour eft precouise
BodDHumd2.Note:
With an introduction, for which, see ‘Agriculture…’,
                    and a table of contents, ff. ix-xviiiv and two-stanza envoy;
                    photographic facsimile is Oxford,  Bodleian Library Arch. Dd.1 (SC 31502) [photographic facsimile (1893) of Oxford,  Bodleian Library Duke Humfrey d.2 [olim Earl Fitzwilliam]], ff. 19-260v, made
                    in 1893 as ‘Earl Fitzwilliam MS of Palladius on
                    Husbondrie’.
BodDHumd2.Editions:
Liddell,  Mark Harvey,
                        ed.  
             The Middle-English translation of Palladius de re rustica.
         Berlin: Ebering, 1896. 
De la Mare,  A. C. 
             “Duke Humfrey’s English Palladius (MS. Duke Humfrey d.2).” 
             Bodleian Library Record
         12, no. 1 (Oct., 1985): 39-51, figs 1-4: 39-51, figs 1-4.

GULHun104.First Lines:
…Vche graffe and grayne is good but aftir preefDo sowe or
                    graffe And seedis newe eschewe…
GULHun104.Last Lines:
…Yit lond so lute & lene if hit be softeWol bere gresse if
                    hit be wattred ofte…
